intro: Dianthus purpureimaculatus, commonly known as the purple-spotted campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant pink to purple flowers with distinctive red or purple spots. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in clusters, often in shades of pink, red, and white, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements. Dianthus purpureimaculatus thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, preferring cooler climates.
